record.dc:title: 74BY11 Rymer, Bradley County, Tennessee. Burial 15BY124, an adult male (at right); burial 15BY125, a juvenile male (at left). Triangular projectile point (F.S. 1708) lies over 9th and 10th ribs of burial 124, on left side of 15BY124 another similar point (F.S. 1709) was found between the 3rd and 4th lumbar vertebrae. Square 29R4. Direction SE.
record.wpa:narrative: [15BY124] Adult male in fair condition, extended on back with head to NW. Buried immediately to the left of 15BY125 in the same pit--projectile points appear to have penetrated into body cavity--at least the one penetrating the lumbar vertebrae is certainly traumatic. [15BY125] Juvenile male in poor condition, extended on back with head to NW. Buried immediately to the right of 15BY124 in the same pit--interment appears to have been simultaneous.
